Text:
How do you remove the SACD audio to 24 bit FLAC if its an .ISO? Can dBPowerAmp extract the tracks?

Can you give me a link to figure this stuff out? The cost of buying the SACD's is way to expensive. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thanks for the upload.

best solution i've found so far for breaking up FLACs with .cue files is xrecode II...can also be done with medieval cue splitter, but i've had trouble with the latter and none with the former...
hope this helpz!
